questions.q: Which of the following best describes 'ubiquity' in e-commerce?
questions.explanation: Ubiquity refers to being available everywhere at all times.
options: Accessible everywhere, anytime via digital devices

questions.q: What is the primary function of the Internet Protocol (IP)?
questions.explanation: IP is responsible for addressing and routing packets to their destination.
options: To address and route data packets across networks

questions.q: Which cloud service is most suitable for a company that wants to develop applications without managing infrastructure?
questions.explanation: PaaS (Platform as a Service) provides a framework for developers to build applications.

questions.q: What does 'global reach' in e-commerce enable?
questions.explanation: Global reach allows businesses to cross cultural and national boundaries.
options: Sales only in the home country
Transactions across national boundaries without modification

questions.q: Which tool would a business use to automate repetitive administrative tasks?
questions.explanation: RPA (Robotic Process Automation) handles repetitive, rules-based tasks.

questions.q: What is the main purpose of a 'digital twin'?
questions.explanation: A digital twin is a virtual representation of a real-world object or system.
options: To create a virtual model of a physical system for analysis

questions.q: Which of the following is an example of an enterprise social network?
questions.explanation: Yammer is specifically designed for private communication within organizations.

questions.q: What is a key benefit of using mobile platforms in business?
questions.explanation: Mobile platforms allow employees to work from anywhere at any time.

questions.q: Which e-commerce model involves influencers offering services to businesses?
questions.explanation: C2B (Consumer-to-Business) involves individuals providing value to companies.

questions.q: What does 'information density' in e-commerce lead to?
questions.explanation: Higher information density improves the quality and reduces the cost of information.
options: Lower costs and higher quality information

questions.q: Which protocol is part of the TCP/IP suite and ensures error-free data delivery?
questions.explanation: TCP manages the connection and ensures all packets arrive correctly.

questions.q: What is a primary use case for an extranet?
questions.explanation: An extranet allows authorized outsiders to access specific internal data.

questions.q: Which technology is often used alongside AI for data analysis?
questions.explanation: Machine Learning is a subset of AI used to find patterns in data.

questions.q: What is a common challenge in B2C e-commerce?
questions.explanation: B2C markets are highly saturated and face constant security threats.
options: No need for user experience focus

questions.q: Which of the following is a characteristic of social e-commerce?
questions.explanation: Social e-commerce leverages social media for buying and selling.
options: Enabled by social networks and online communities

questions.q: What is the role of 'hypertext' in the web?
questions.explanation: Hypertext allows users to click links to move between pages.
options: To store data in the cloud
To link documents through embedded links

questions.q: Which cloud model delivers software via subscription over the internet?
questions.explanation: SaaS (Software as a Service) provides ready-to-use applications via the web.

questions.q: What does IoT stand for?
questions.explanation: IoT refers to physical objects connected to the internet.

questions.q: Which tool is specifically designed for data visualization in business?
questions.explanation: Power BI is a Microsoft tool for creating interactive reports and dashboards.

questions.q: What is the primary purpose of 'client/server' architecture?
questions.explanation: It splits tasks between servers (providers) and clients (service requesters).
options: To centralize resources and manage requests
To eliminate the need for the internet
To use only one computer for all tasks
